title: Permanently banned for no reason
body:
Alright, I just had my account permanently banned for this? 

This, to me, is insane...

Tyriel: coming back to blue
Tyriel: gj
Tyriel: dude
Tyriel: you have got to stop dying
Tyriel: it wasn't sarcasm
Tyriel: I thought you were singed for a second.
Tyriel: you rageful idiot.
Tyriel: I mean... I'm getting 22 and 23 points a game per win. This loss means literally nothign to me.
Tyriel: lunatic lol
Tyriel: welp
Tyriel: enjoy the free win I guess. Vayne admitted to feeding intentionally.
Tyriel: gj bot
Tyriel: and she has five dorans blades
Tyriel: intense.
Tyriel: aight
Tyriel: gg wp. Top trolling pretty hard.
Tyriel: now vayne's afk lol
Tyriel: vayne afk btw
Tyriel: please report.
Tyriel: why not ff?
Tyriel: jhin
Tyriel: look at vayne
Tyriel: there's not going to BE a late game
Tyriel: vayne has 50 cs
Tyriel: at 17 minutes
Tyriel: she's trolling the crap out of us by even saying "play for the late game"
Tyriel: this vayne came into the game tilted. It's basically a 4v5
Tyriel: and what's worse is she fed anyway.
Tyriel: u right ekko
Tyriel: I'm not gonna stop trying
Tyriel: but the game is over
Tyriel: sorry man
Tyriel: Troll vayne
Tyriel: 2 and 8 with 5 doran's blades still. Sighman
Tyriel: I didn't know she was gonna do this dude
Tyriel: how would I know that?
Tyriel: not all vayne tops are trolling homie
Tyriel: I totally agree, but other vaynes wouldn't int feed necessarily and refuse to build items man
Tyriel: she could have at least TRIED, ya know?/
Tyriel: not THAT bad and like I said at least they'd farm
Tyriel: atleast they'd build items and be halfway relevant.
Tyriel: homie I am in agreement that most vayne tops are dumb, but give me a break here.
Tyriel: I am. Doesn't make you less annoying.
Tyriel: this guy is so toxic.

replies.body:
I would put money on it you just recently came off a 14 day ban. 

Very very thin ice at that point. If you flash a mastery the wrong way youll be perma-ed.

I had been assigned a 14 day ban, yes, but I had also been making huge strides in the effort of reform. My attitude was GLARINGLY better than it had been, and that 14 DB was quite a while ago. I had even gotten rewards assigned back to me and earned my way back into getting loot and ALL of that... then out of nowhere I got slammed with a perma. Come on...

If you're toxic enough to get a 14 day ban, you get a warning message that specifically says " ONE LAST CHANCE"

that means you cannot fuck up or you will be perma banned. That doesnt mean you can be less of an asshole to your team, it means you shouldnt type in the game for 6 months at least.

"shouldn't type in the game for 6 months"

that seems unreasonable.

No.. what seems unreasonable is you thinking you being banned is unfair lol. You were warned at least 5 times, punished at least 5 times over the years, and within a few weeks after your 14 day ban, you were toxic again.. You didnt reform after 5 punishments, so the community, and Riot is done with you.. Have fun in Dota 2.

I won't have fun in Dota 2, I'll still be playing league. Thanks for that, though.

It wasn't "a few weeks" it was more like a few months. And then I got slammed by a permaban out of nowhere, lol. You're not getting the facts straight at all and making grand assumptions that I was still "horribly toxic" when I wasn't. I made HUGE bounds of reform, whether or not you believe that, and even got rewards back and everything. That's what you seem unwilling to understand.
You were toxic. You didnt reform. And you got banned and the community can be happy for you getting such a punishment.
Nope. Still gonna play.

If I use chat too much then give me the ability to disable it. Muting people clearly does not work, and if I use the chat feature I guess that's just going to put me in danger near constantly?

This game is a glaring example of a shakey punishment system. I did nothing wrong in this game, which is hardly even arguable. I have the RIGHT to complain when someone goes top, goes 2-13 and buys NOTHING but doran's blades...

come on, Riot. This one is NOT fair. 


http://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/NA1/2593700977/213918795?tab=overview

Having a negative attitude towards your allies.

"I did nothing wrong in this game"

My "ally" openly fed and trolled his entire team. I have a right to complain without just being permanently banned for that. I wasn't being outright unruly. I didn't quit the game. I didn't afk or start inting or cursing everyone out in frustration. I played the game out... to the end. I did nothing wrong, yet the guy that trolled everyone throws a report my way and I'M the one that gets banned? That's bonkers, man.

In fact the two week ban I received before, which I will admit was deserved, was months ago. I hadn't gotten any attention past that point, and then all of a sudden I get slapped with this? I don't think that's fair at all.

thats what got me banned they said arguing is considered an offense same shiit happened to me and they say you are responsible with whatever happens with yoiur account im like what how is it my fault to complain against a stupid dumb player they said shouldve used mute button makes no sense at all

Then give me a chat ban or something. This is downright nuts. I'm getting a PERMA for complaining?

...what?

when i am sitting in a game and somebody starts to fk up at some point and you start to complain then we have to 2 things going in this moment:

you are making him play even worse since he will either focus on how bad he is or second on the chatting part to argue with you. 

Now i have 2 people which are not 100 % focussing on the game and lower my experience. Gj. Reported.

They THEN told me "is that a good enough job for you, Jarvan?" to which I replied "My earlier comment was NOT sarcastic"

............................

What else am I supposed to do to please you and prove that I was not being toxic AT all? The guy literally took something out of context and his brain exploded after ONE death. He then proceeded to troll the entirety of our team as a result of ATTEMPTED encouragement. 

But no, I'm a toxic scumbag.

You know what the major part does which never gets a 10 games chat restriction? get along since it's a game and you dont lose money, muted that idiot and report him after. He will get punished and come here to the boards while he is getting angry and you can have a laugh about him.

And dont tell me the report system wouldn't punish him anyway, you are here too which shows that the system is doing it's job.

Right, because the system is designed to permanently ban people who are pointing out things that are bannable. That's the way it's intended to work...   ???

That makes no sense. Why should I be punished because I openly complained about someone acting like a jerk? It's simply not fair.
You do this consistently enough i presume. Yea makes sense.

That's the thing. I don't do it consistently. I had been making HUGE strides to reform and had even been given back the ability to gain loot and ALL of that. I got a gift the other DAY for "keeping it civil" though that's not a direct quote. Give me a break, here.

Considering you look at these current logs as not toxic(which they actually are) i'd say it's safe to say you're prob consistently toxic in riot's views, so na.


Besides you have no one to blame but yourself, you threw it all away because of one person... try not being thin skinned.

I can't agree with you here. I wasn't trying to be toxic. I was practicing my right to complain about someone who was openly trolling/being toxic to the entirety of their team. You say it's being toxic, I say it was complaining. I didn't just let the guy have it and start raging and flaming him. He chose to be toxic and I literally just called him on it, yet I am the one who ends up punished.

It doesn't matter what you think it is, it's what riot thinks it is... guess what they thought it was, i'll let you figure that out.


You don't fight toxic with toxic and expect only one person to get in trouble, besides you have no clue if the other person got punished or not, how consistently they do it or not, etc. 


Only thing you're doing is complaining like a child that you got in trouble for being in a fight that someone else started because you're too immature and let it get to you.

Call it immature if you like, but complaining about who is obviously being unpleasant to everyone else in the game is not toxic. I can't agree with you there. People complain all the time, openly to their team and in all chat as well, and they don't get bans for it, and that is ALL I did.

Congrats you complained, hope you're happy.

And if the person keeps it up, they will eventually be banned also.


But for some unknown reason you even though riot has made it clear what you said is toxic, you seem to keep thinking you weren't toxic... so have fun with that.

I will maintain that I was not toxic, yes, because I don't believe that I was, call it a differing opinion and we can agree to disagree, but as I illustrated above in a separate comment...

 That's like kicking the guy out of the bar who yells at the bouncers "Hey, those guys are fighting and it's really annoying" and points at the pair of guys fighting on the other side of the bar, but the spotter gets the boot. It's ridiculous.

No, you seem to not understand your spot in that situation, your case is a spotter pointed to random people fighting and when the bouncer came, you said the other guy started it but the bouncer toss you both out anyways.

You don't seem to understand that you're one of the 2 random people fighting that the bouncer(riot) tossed out.

Okay, so a guy punches me in the face in the bar. I'm supposed to act like a cuck and take it? And if we're splitting hairs, I didn't LOSE it on this guy. I had a few complaints, yea, but I didn't punch him back in the face(figuratively speaking), because to DO that I would have had to start feeding, screaming in the chat or raging like a monkey, start building a bunch of tears or AFK'd from the game.

What I am saying is that, if there was a crime that I have committed here at ALL, what this player did FAR outweighed anything that I did, yet I still disagree that complaining about someone else being toxic is a reportable, and by extension, permanently bannable offense. It's just unfair.

when will you learn it doesn't matter what the other player did.


At any point will you stop being a child saying "Waaa he started it"


You both flamed, you caught a punishment, and eventually he will too. Then End, if you actually just cant understand that then there is 0 hope for you
You didn't yell at the bouncers, you yelled at other random people in the bar. Yelling at the bouncers would be reporting after game.

A great deal of this chat is dedicated towards harassing your top laner. At no point did you try to stop. Vayne may have been toxic, i don't think she was trolling, but again, it's every other line or so that's saying something negative about Vayne.

The player verbally admitted what they were doing in the post game lobby.

I don't know how else to say it, friend. I was complaining about a person who was openly trolling. The player still had 5 doran's blades at the end of the game, yet I am the one who got a permaban...

I'd already looked at the match, unless you were somehow unfortunate enough to have multiple Vayne vs Singed lanes.

You constantly pointed to negative things about someone. It was unending. It was harassment. None of it positive. None of it trying in any way to help, except for the "stop dying" comment. 

When a player is being toxic, I don't see how anything that you said could have helped.

I was pointing to negatives to everyone else in the game. I wasn't slandering the person or raging at them, I was pointing something out so that they could be aware of what said toxic player was doing. But I supposed pointing something out and alarming the community to toxicity IS in fact toxic. Pardon me, please.

I wasn't slandering the person or raging at them, I was pointing something out so that they could be aware of what said toxic player was doing. But I supposed pointing something out and alarming the community to toxicity IS in fact toxic. Pardon me, please.

Here's the thing though: your teammates already know about the behavior, and the last thing that they want or need is you constantly complaining about that one players behavior all game long. Same for the enemy team. It's not helpful, it's not constructive, it's just annoying and disrespectful, hence why you were reported for it.

Also, you already had at least 3 chances to improve your behavior before this and you didn't. When you're on a 14-day ban your account is on thin ice, and one more mistake can cost you the account. While this isn't the worst set of chat logs that I've seen it's still showing you make little effort to improve your behavior, hence the punishment. If you really were working on improving your behavior like you said then great, but this set of chat logs isn't a very good indicator of that unfortunately.

Next time if someone is acting up and refuses to stop then just mute, report and move on instead of spending the majority of the game complaining about them. That time would be better spent focusing on the actual game itself. Good luck in your future endeavors.

I still disagree that "complaining" about another player being toxic is a bannable offense, though, and that's what I can't get around. If I was raging at the guy, cursing him to high heaven, flaming, berating, whatever, then I would actually understand that, but this, DESPITE mass improvement compared to the issue that I admittedly used to be, seems unfair to me. This is nowhere NEAR the horrid things that I've seen other people spew all over League chat logs relentlessly. I got told to "rope" myself just the other day... I've NEVER SAID THAT to anyone. That guy's running around saying stuff like that not getting banned, but I make a couple of complaints and that's not only bannable but worthy of a PERMAban? That's insane.

Also, the repeated comments regarding what the player was doing, although not constructive to my team was also not meant for my team. They knew what was going on rather early on in the match. The repeated comments about the player inting and carrying on in a negative way was made in all chat to the other team who inquired about what the heck was going on and I told them. I then continued to discuss it, perhaps giving it a little more thought than I should have, but hey as long as we're banning someone for explaining things and lodging a couple of complaints then I suppose we're all doomed. 

Either way, I can't disagree more. This isn't even close to permaban worthy and I can do nothing but stand by that opinion as I challenge the harsh decision for reacting in a disappointed fashion to something that someone else was doing. That's like kicking the guy out of the bar who yells at the bouncers "Hey, those guys are fighting and it's really annoying" and points at the pair of guys fighting on the other side of the bar, but the spotter gets the boot. It's ridiculous.

> [{quoted}](name=Tyriel,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=1VkEXkL2,comment-id=000500000000000000000000,timestamp=2017-09-09T08:27:13.366+0000)

That guy's running around saying stuff like that not getting banned, but I make a couple of complaints and that's not only bannable but worthy of a PERMAban? That's insane.

You were punished based on your behavior alone and the fact that despite receiving prior punishments you still acted in a negative manner consistently enough to get punished again. You cannot get punished based on someone elses behavior, and so what if other people were behaving worse? The "he started it" excuse didn't work in school and it doesn't work here. Also, the question isn't "is this permaban worthy?" but rather "is this punish worthy?" instead, to which the answer is yes. Ordinarily this reform card would receive a chat restriction at most, but since you had a 14-day ban prior to this you were assigned the next available punishment, which in this case was a permaban.

It's important to note that punishments are handed out based on the consistency of ones poor behavior. Having an off day/game or two when you normally don't act like that won't get you punished, but a consistent enough pattern of negative behavior will. Yes it stinks to see people who act up go unpunished for as long as they sometimes do but that's just the way it works unfortunately (better this than to punish people unfairly for just having off days/games).

> Also, the repeated comments regarding what the player was doing, although not constructive to my team was also not meant for my team. They knew what was going on rather early on in the match. The repeated comments about the player inting and carrying on in a negative way was made in all chat to the other team who inquired about what the heck was going on and I told them. I then continued to discuss it, perhaps giving it a little more thought than I should have, but hey as long as we're banning someone for explaining things and lodging a couple of complaints then I suppose we're all doomed. 

Even if it wasn't meant for your team they still had to put up with your constant complaining about the vayne as did the enemy team assuming no one on either team muted you. I understand that you were explaining what was happening due to them asking, but as you admit you continued on for longer than you should have. Explaining it once or twice? Fine. Complaining about it for the whole game? Not fine.

You want to help get troublemakers punished? Then report them when you see them. Complaining about them all game long is not only pointless but it also takes time away from playing the actual game itself.

> Either way, I can't disagree more. This isn't even close to permaban worthy and I can do nothing but stand by that opinion as I challenge the harsh decision for reacting in a disappointed fashion to something that someone else was doing. It's ridiculous.

Ordinarily this reform card would receive a chat restriction at most, but since you had a 14-day ban prior to this you were assigned the next available punishment, which in this case was a permaban. Why? Because the IFS deemed that you hadn't improved enough to warrant a lesser punishment.

Also, since you brought up the bar analogy in this case it would be akin to getting involved in the fight after alerting management to it. You want to get the word out about someone, great, but there's no need to get involved in the fight yourself unless your life depended on it, which in this case it doesn't. By making the situation worse you ensured that the 3 of you get the boot. Next time if you must speak then say it once or twice and leave it at that and don't make it worse than it already is.

Yet I complain about a player's crap behavior in one game and I deserve to get permanently banned when my attitude had been in check for SOOO long? No. That's absolutely nuts. Why in the world would I EVER genuinely care to reform on any other account I play on if their system is clearly flawed in that it doesn't take into consideration the massive strides I had taken to improve to begin with?

I cleaned up my language. I started muting(which I did in that game in order to silence the inting, toxic Vane). I started trying to diffuse situations between teammates rather than causing more aggravation by salting the wound or any of that. I busted my butt to get back into the good graces I had found myself outside of for a while, and ACTUALLY GOT BACK IN... then, after one game that I complained about a top laner who was obviously, visibly being a scumbag, I got shot down in flames. THAT is NOT... fair. Not at all.

He hated what Vayne was doing, lodged his complaint openly more than once int he chat logs and did not get a ban or a warning of any kind. Beyond that, what you're basically telling me is to not use chat at all, which seems a little ridiculous because it is a feature of the GAME. 

Noted. DO NOT use the chat system provided by league of legends. And when I say this I am not joking. I've moved the chat OFF of my screen on my other account because it's clear that Riot doesn't actually delve into any of these chat logs honestly. They just let their system do all the work. A system that is ripe with errors because Riot is tired of dirtying their hands with all of this. I understand that, and I wouldn't want to both with the obelisk of toxicity that is the League community either, but for an instance like this it is glaringly apparent that this system is flawed.

Right, because going for so long without being punished or having my attitude examined doesn't really mean anything. Going for so long with such good behavior that I EARNED my rewards and the honor system back isn't a massive stride of improvement. I had the 14 day ban WAYYYYY before the new honor system was implemented and I didn't apply for it to begin with, so I never had it because rewards/honor system was disabled already by the time they implemented it. I was actually excited about the new honor system and worked hard to earn it AND rewards. Then, after months of no problem, I got slammed with this? Get out of here.

I get what you're saying about what the question really is, I do. It's not "is this permaban worthy" it's "is this reportable". I fully understand your standpoint, but when I go two, or almost two months with no troubles in regards to my behavior and then I get this, it's literally out of NOWHERE. I got blindsided by this harder than anything gaming related. This was something I didn't expect AT all, and that is because I had been SOOOOO good lately. I hadn't been tearing people down, raging constantly, AFKing from games, feeding or griefing people. Apart from some small complaints, actually, and I hadn't done ANYTHING wrong. I was just a player enjoying the game that I had been working hard to reform in, but because that "report" button is so easily accessible to EVERYONE in the game, regardless of their attitude or their prior infractions, someone who really isn't toxic at all these days got a permaban, and that's what I can't get my head around.

Your jungler could accidentally take a BLUE from the mid laner, and if you don't like that or if that put a bad taste in your mouth you could click that report button at the end of that game and that one report could ACTUALLY effect them. It's not that likely, but that stuff happens, and you KNOW people report other players for petty, small things like that all of the time. The system is broken as long as people can be reported over nothing or next to nothing. Lodging a rightful complaint, which this seems to be in my opinion, should not be reportable. I guess I'll be one of the select few that gets a permanent ban for complaining about someone else being toxic, though. Seems fair.

How is it not permaban worthy? You've had 3 other chances to change and reform but yet you still continue to be toxic and negative. You've shown that you won't change, riot and i'm sure everyone else is happy to not have you in their game.

I'm gonna keep playing the game one way or the other. The ban isn't going to change anything. I just disagree that it was fair.
